alert.note: Alert for Central and East Adams and Arapahoe Counties; Central and South Weld County; Larimer County Below 6000 Feet, Northwest Weld County; Logan County; Morgan County; North and Northeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, North Lincoln County; Northeast Weld County; Phillips County; Sedgwick County; Washington County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued October 28 at 7:11PM MDT until October 29 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...HEAVIER SNOW MOVING INTO THE FOOTHILLS AND I-25 CORRIDOR THIS EVENING... .The heaviest snow associated with the current weather system will spread across the foothills and Interstate 25 corridor this evening, and will spread across the plains east and southeast of Denver overnight. Periods of heavy snow with snowfall rates over an inch per hour can be expected in the foothills and from Boulder and Denver south to Monument Hill this evening. This will cause roads to become slushy or icy at times in these areas, especially in the foothills west and southwest of Denver. Travelers should allow extra time and drive carefully this evening, or consider delaying unnecessary travel. The snow will decrease later tonight, though light snow will continue into Sunday morning and roads may still be slippery in some areas. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON MDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations between 2 and 4 inches. * WHERE...Fort Collins, Greeley, Limon and northeastern Colorado. * WHEN...Until noon MDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Roads will likely become slick and hazardous.
info.instruction: Roads will be slick resulting in slow and hazardous travel. Allow extra time to reach your destination. The latest road conditions for Colorado can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or by going to www.cotrip.org.
